page.title: 19Glossop Mountain Rescue Team
page.content: The{Mountain Rescue Team}consists of volunteers. Once a month they meet to discuss mountain rescue and to practise using their radios. The{volunteers}may be called out at anytime, day or night. The team leader calls out all the members of his team. They all then meet at the mountain rescue post which is at{ {Glossop Police Station.}They check they have all got the right equipment before setting out for the moors. The areas covered by the Glossop Mountain Rescue Team include Kinderscout, the Snake Pass, Mam Tor and Hayfield. The team go as far as possible by{landrover}or sometimes{ even by{helicopter}before continuing on{foot.}To call out the Mountain Rescue Team you go to a telephone box, dial{999} and ask for "Mountain Rescue."
